description.narrative: The Kiribati Education Improvement Program (KEIP) aims for all children to have access to quality education through 9 years of compulsory schooling. KEIP will: rehabilitate 93 primary and junior secondary schools in Kiribati; establish a modern legislative and evidence-based policy framework in which education can be delivered; improve teachers' professional development; and deliver a revised national curriculum and assessment system. All children will achieve functional literacy and numeracy after 6 years of basic education and be equipped with the skills they need to continue to the next stage of education. Kiribati will have a comprehensive and inclusive education sector that is adequately funded and managed to provide quality education services to all children. A Senior Education Management Specialist position placed within Ministry of Education complements the KEIP support through sectoral policy planning and management, started 2011-2019.
